title: Extensions
content:
Before the search engine change to v57, I used to use an Extension called "Textarea Cache." It still works on Waterfox. If you lose text from an entry box & it isn't in the clipboard, Textarea Cache still saves it for recovery. Is there any extension in the current FireFox that does the same function?

I lost so many important extensions when FireFox upgraded that I mostly use WaterFox these days despite the better security of Firefox. Too many lost critical extensions that have no work-alike in post v.57 Firefox - like Classic Theme Restorer, All-in-One Sidebar, Vertical SideBar, etc.
creator: Bluesun03

title: "Your Browser Is Being Managed By Your Organization" suddenly appeared in my Firefox 114 settings page
content:
I've looked into this situation, and none of the solutions submitted online work.

I went to about:preferences, and set "security.certerrors.mitm.auto_enable_enterprise_roots" to false, but "security.enterprise_roots.enabled" is set to true and locked; I can't change it.

First of all, I am not using Avast, AVG, Kapersky, etc. antivirus; I'm using Win 10's built-in security suite, so it's not my antivirus causing it.

To double check that, I opened the Registry and went to " HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox\" and "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox\", looking for a Mozilla\Firefox\Polices key, and neither one had any Mozilla keys.

I even checked the Autoconfig settings, and found no settings in the JS file that had anything to do with Enterpise Roots (I renamed the file temporarily to disable it), but I still can't disable security.enterprise_roots.enabled

I have no "Organization"; I'm an independent home user, so needless to say I'm concerned that Firefox is suddenly saying some organization is controlling my Firefox.

Win 10 Home Ver. 22H2 OS Build: 19045.3086 Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.19041.1000.0

Antivirus/Firewall: Windows 10 Security

Firefox: 114.0.2 (64 bit)
creator: Darkeforce

title: Idea to have domain names without extension like .com .org etc
content:
Hi, I am thinking to have domain names without extensions like .com or .org. etc

The idea consist to have a primary dns conection server and a secondary dns server. When introduce the name on url, the navigator look if the word introduced has or not extension. If have then send the query to traditional dns, if not, then send the query to secondary dns to check what ip correspond to, and send you to the webpage.

Do you like the idea?

By the way I save a copy of this emal, I like to see my name on invention.

Best regards

Mario Jimenez

I tried numerous things, but the problem persisted. I finally did a reinstall/refresh and got the full window to open. However, I have lost all of my bookmarks and pins. Is there a way to restore these items from the last session before these updates and problems? Or can you do this for me>

Thanks for any help you can give me.

title: migrating browser data to new laptop
content:
More than four years ago I created a mozzilla account on my work laptop, in hope of easier migration, syncing between devices, and similar promises. I signed into the account, and have been happily using Firefox ever since, with that 1 time login, thanks for that.

Recently I got a new work laptop and I wanted to use syncing, but I unfortunately had to realise that I do not remember the password I gave 4 years ago (since I was never once prompted to provide it again). So I tried to reset my password. Up until this point I was never warned, that one e-mail account provided would not be enough for password resets.

I tried providing a secondary e-mail address, but that doesn't give me a password reset option. I also tried activating 2fa according to the tutorial, with two different apps (authy and google authenticator) but the browser always says invalid key, so I failed activating 2fa. I tried password reset, but it says I will lose all the data, I would like to sync, so that is not a reasonable option... I tried to manually migrate my profile over to the new laptop, by replacing "Profiles" folder contents on the new laptop, but that just makes Firefox unable to start even.

So I am at my wits end, and begging for help. Looked at reddit posts on how to get browse data to new pc and official support faq-s but I do not see a solution.

I am still signed in, on the old work laptop, that is where I'm writing this plea for help from.

I would really love to recover my account and sync it to the new device.

After typing it out I realize how "social engineeringy/hacky" this message sounds. But I'm willing to prove my identity, by any means necessary, and the account mail address is my name (that is also on my national id card).

Please help me, or advise me how to proceed and reset my password without losing all my data.

yours truly Ferenc Patai
creator: ferenc.patai

title: Boost Your Productivity Mozilla Tips and Tricks to Streamline Your Online Workflow
content:
Mozilla offers a range of features and functionalities that can greatly enhance your productivity while browsing the web. By leveraging these tips and tricks, you can optimize your online workflow and accomplish tasks more efficiently. Here are some Mozilla tips and tricks to help you streamline your online productivity:

Tab Management Techniques: a) Utilize Tab Groups: Take advantage of Mozilla's built-in tab grouping feature to organize related tabs into groups. This helps declutter your browser window and allows you to switch between different contexts seamlessly. b) Keyboard Shortcuts: Learn and use keyboard shortcuts like Ctrl/Cmd + T to open new tabs, Ctrl/Cmd + W to close tabs, and Ctrl/Cmd + Tab to cycle through open tabs. These shortcuts can save you time and improve your browsing speed related to Mtg Proxy

Bookmark Organization: a) Create Folders: Organize your bookmarks into folders based on different topics or categories. This makes it easier to locate and access saved web pages when needed. b) Sync Across Devices: If you have a Firefox account, sync your bookmarks across multiple devices. This ensures that your bookmarks are always accessible, regardless of the device you're using.

title: Certificado digital - desabilitar opção "Memorizar esta decisão"
content:
Bom dia,

Estou com um problema com relação a opção "Memorizar esta decisão" para certificado digital.

Removi o navegador Firefox e instalei novamente, ele volta para configuração padrão. Na primeira vez ao selecionar o certificado, tem a opção: Memorizar esta decisão que precisar estar desmarcada.

Porém cada vez que for selecionar um certificado, é necessário desmarcar esta opção novamente. Faço isso pois temos clientes diferentes para acesso, e é necessário selecionar um certificado diferente.

Tentei limpar os cookies e continua da mesma forma. Utilizei o caminho:

Clique no ícone do Menu no canto superior direito: Clique no Histórico. Clique em Limpar histórico recente. No intervalo de tempo para limpar: selecione Tudo. Selecione as caixas aplicáveis para Cookies e Cache. Clique no botão OK.

É possível desabilitar a opção "Memorizar esta decisão" em vez na tela de certificados? Existe alguma opção para restaurar as configurações padrões para certificados?

Obrigado.
creator: alan_santos2002

title: [macOS] When multiple windows are fullscreened, is it possible to close one fullscreen window at a time instead of all fullscreen windows (with the macOS fullscreen API config enabled)?
content:
Hi! I previously used Google Chrome, and would typically have multiple windows in fullscreen (different YouTube pages, for example). On Chrome, if I fullscreen multiple windows, and then escape the fullscreen for only one of them, the rest remain in fullscreen.

In Firefox, I enable the macOS fullscreen API, as I prefer my windows to enter the Mission Control space after fullscreening. When I then open multiple fullscreen windows, and escape only one of them, then ALL fullscreen windows also escape and return to normal size at the same time, whereas Chrome allows the rest of the windows to stay in fullscreen.

Is there any way around this such that it has the same behavior as Chrome? This is the only real issue that's holding me back from making the change to Firefox, so if there's any way to fix this, that'd be amazing! Thanks so much!

title: firefox does not open downloaded files automatically
content:
Running Firefox 114.0.1 on Ubuntu 23.04 Wayland (64 bits). I recently updated from Ubuntu 22.04 to 23.04. Firefox got updated accordingly. I replaced the snap version with deb package (from MozillaTeam/PPA), version 114.0.1. Since then, Firefox 114.0.1 (and also 114.0.2, recently updated) does not open downloaded files automatically. It doesn’t matter if the corresponding file mime type is registred or not in Firefox configuration. When you click on a link, in the first case Firefox downloads the file, and then nothing happens. In the second case, Firefox asks for a program to open it, and once selected, nothing happens. In any case, you can go to the download folder and doble click on the file, and it opens without problem.

I have tried Firefox save mode, dissabling all extensions, and even with a newly created profile, but it makes no difference. I installed Firefox ESR (version 102.12.0-ESR) locally on my user folder, and it works as expected.

As an exemple, if you go to http://entropymine.com/jason/testbed/mime/, and click on any link on the last two rows of the table, Firefox ESR launches the corresponding app, while nothing happens with Firefox 114.

title: OOM | small - you know, why it is not handled by your programms?
content: Hi, something happened, and same computer working good for a long time, now is crashing as crazy. i sent a bunch of reports few minutes ago, one of them is bp-2d239006-2355-4fb0-b78e-76cce0230622. i can see my win 10 is not configured to work with Mozilla software (both Thunderbird and Firefox i am using crashes and no other programs i am using does this). i don't know exactly why, you know better from all those reports, i would like to get rid of them, be back a happy user, for sure. shouldn't all crashes be handled by the programs? let say it is a memory problem, an OS problem, anything and everything - when a program crashes, it didn't handle the situation. I'm not more a programmer, but if i give to someone a program which crashes, and after i tell him it is your environment, what kind of programmer i am? what knows the user? why is not possible to verify you will have the memory you want to use before using it? if there is no space find out, and handle it. you choose to crash. -- i replaced the hdd, (but i copy the same data on the new one) i replaced the memory, i replaced the motherboard, i replaced everything, but not the software. it is not a hardware problem here. only a bad management, os - program, ... program! thanks for your help.

title: Tab foregrounds become gray for NYTimes pages
content:
In Firefox 114.0.2, the tab foreground color for most NYTimes.com pages initially is black, but after an instant, the foreground color now becomes gray. The background color is a similar gray, so the tab symbol for the NYTimes (beginning with an ornate letter T) cannot be distinguished from the background. The NYTimes tab foreground color used to remain black.

For an example, go to https://www.nytimes.com/. The tab foreground colors for some NYTimes pages remain black; for example, go to https://help.nytimes.com/hc/en-us. I think this tab foreground color change began recently, less than a month ago. This problem does not occur for web sites other than the NYTimes. Restarting my computer does not help. This tab color problem does not occur in Edge or Chrome.

Thanks for any info

title: More and more problems
content:
About 2 or 3 updates ago...after the update I can not clear all my web browsing history. I have my homepage set to Firefox's " about:preferences#privacy " I usually clear all the ' stored cookies, site data ' through the " Clear Data' button. Have it set to clear ALL data. Also clear " History " data and too ALL data. 

Then I use " CCleaner " to clear any data that might have been left on my PC.  It/CCleaner too has settings to clean Firefox's Cache, history, cookies, download history, session and more which use to work very well on clearing all data of web browsing.   That doesn't do it anymore.   After all the effort I go through after closing Firefox to delete/eliminate all my browsing history... through the manual tic-buttons IN Firefox... AND with the settings to clear cookies, site data and history upon closing.  PLUS using CCleaner.   I ALSO close down/disable my 'Wireless Network' modem EVERY TIME I close Firefox  because I've had programs... AV program... that had stupid-non-disabling auto update that would connect... on it's own... to the net and not only check for it's update but downloads updates on every program update-able.  But with all the work and precautions.... NOW when I click on Firefox to start a whole new session... remember all the moves I take AFTER the last session... It/Firefox asks if I want to continue with my last session and shows the sites I was at the last time. If there is anyway to get... MY PRIVACY BACK!!! ... I would LOVE to hear about it. I would LOVE to have my "Firefox 2.0. " back where/when there were no problems.
creator: ynot_jd
